phrases: Brian is a 58-year-old male with a past medical history significant for congestive heart failure and hypertension, who presents today for follow-up of his chronic problems.

I just feel out of sorts lately. I don’t know if it’s the change in the seasons or if we’re just doing a lot of projects around the house and some construction on our own. I’m just feeling out of it. Lack of energy. I’m just tired and fatigued, and I feel kinda. I feel lightheaded every once in a while.
Probably since Labor Day, about five weeks or.

We began construction on our kitchen over Labor Day weekend, and it was hard to cook or prepare meals. We ate out a lot, and not always the best food out. It wreaked havoc; it’s been maybe off a little bit.
Jugular venous distention to about eight centimeters.
A three out of six systolic ejection murmur.
Fine crackles at the bases bilaterally.
1+ pitting edema in the lower extremities.
Chest x-ray demonstrates a mild amount of fluid in the lungs.
Echocardiogram shows a reduced ejection fraction of 45% and mild mitral regurgitation.
Increase Lasix to 80mg once a day.
Wean yourself every day. I want you to call me if you’re gaining more weight.
Continue lisinopril 20mg a day for hypertension.
I monitor it regularly. My wife makes sure I stay on top of that, but it’s been pretty good.
Slight cramps [chest pain] that go away after about an hour.
A slight cough, and again, I’m not sure if it’s just the change of seasons and I’m getting a cold.
